EmailTemplate.subject: 8/16 Webinar: Mixing Analytic Workloads with Greenplum and Apache Spark
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
Please join us for the webinar Mixing Analytic Workloads with Greenplum and Apache Spark <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars/aug-16-mixing-analytic-workloads-with-greenplum-and-apache-spark-webinar?utm_source=digest&utm_medium=webinars&utm_campaign=greenplum-apache-spark&utm_term=q318]]>, on August 16, 2018.
Apache Spark is a popular in-memory data analytics engine because of its speed, scalability, and ease of use. It also fits well with DevOps practices and cloud-native software platforms. It’s good for data exploration, interactive analytics, and streaming use cases.
However, Spark, like other data-processing platforms, is not one size fits all. Different versions of Spark support different feature sets, and Spark’s machine-learning libraries can also vary in important ways between versions, or may lack the right algorithm.
In this webinar, you’ll learn:
- How to integrate data warehouse workloads with Spark
- Which workloads are better for Greenplum and for Spark
- How to use the Greenplum-Spark connector
Presenters: Kong Yew Chan, Product Manager, Pivotal
Date: Thursday, August 16, 2018 Time: 11:00am PDT / 2:00pm EDT
Attend <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars/aug-16-mixing-analytic-workloads-with-greenplum-and-apache-spark-webinar?utm_source=digest&utm_medium=webinars&utm_campaign=greenplum-apache-spark&utm_term=q318]]>
We thank you in advance for joining us. The Pivotal Team
